coref: The Fox one day thought of a plan to amuse The Fox at the expense of the Stork, at whose odd appearance The Fox was always laughing. You must come and dine with The Fox today, The Fox said to the Stork, smiling to The Fox at the trick The Fox was going to play. the Stork the Stork gladly accepted the invitation and arrived in good time and with a very good appetite. For dinner The Fox The Fox served soup, But it was set out in a very shallow dish, and the Stork could do was to wet the very tip of The Fox bill. Not a drop of soup could The Fox get, But The Fox The Fox lapped it up easily, and, to increase the disappointment of the Stork, made a great show of enjoyment. the Stork the Stork was much displeased at the trick, but The Fox was a calm, even-tempered fellow and saw no good in flying into a rage. Instead, not long afterward, The Fox invited The Fox The Fox to dine with The Fox in turn. The Fox The Fox arrived promptly at the time that had been set, and the Stork served a fish dinner that had a very appetizing smell. But the Stork was served in a tall jar with a very narrow neck. the Stork could easily get at the food with his bill, but The Fox The Fox could do was to lick the outside of a tall jar, and sniff at the delicious odor. And when The Fox The Fox lost The Fox temper, the Stork said calmly: Do not play tricks on your neighbors unless you can stand the same treatment yourself.
